poem:
Title: "A Spectacle in Court"

Within the court's glaring eye resides
A man undone by ambition's tide.
Ask of Kimmel - comic jester, seer fair -
Why lies this folly not on the public air?
In slumber, the erstwhile victor caught,
Before justice, silent and taut.
His offspring flounders in the glare,
In the final act of this tragic affair.
